body_html:
@drpngx Hi, I'm following this:

TF_INC=$(python -c 'import tensorflow as tf; print(tf.sysconfig.get_include())')
TF_LIB=$(python -c 'import tensorflow as tf; print(tf.sysconfig.get_lib())')
g++ -std=c++11 -shared zero_out.cc -o zero_out.so -fPIC -I$TF_INC -I$TF_INC/external/nsync/public -L$TF_LIB -ltensorflow_framework -O2

This solved my problem on ubuntu. As for mac os, I suggest you to try instructions on this document: https://www.tensorflow.org/extend/adding_an_op . Below there is some for mac os.

body:
@drpngx Hi, I'm following this:
```
TF_INC=$(python -c 'import tensorflow as tf; print(tf.sysconfig.get_include())')
TF_LIB=$(python -c 'import tensorflow as tf; print(tf.sysconfig.get_lib())')
g++ -std=c++11 -shared zero_out.cc -o zero_out.so -fPIC -I$TF_INC -I$TF_INC/external/nsync/public -L$TF_LIB -ltensorflow_framework -O2
```
This solved my problem on ubuntu. As for mac os, I suggest you to try instructions on this document: https://www.tensorflow.org/extend/adding_an_op . Below there is some for mac os.
